abstract:
original article in the English language
OIC [object-in-context] task
rodents
control animals
report the sample size and (the data to calculate) the DR [discrimination ratio] with the corresponding standard error

other measures of context-dependent memory, like modified versions of the OIC [object-in-context] task (e.g. combinations of context and location measures, context-dependent memory based on odors, classical fear conditioning or operant conditioning paradigms)
no control group tested. no treatment, saline injection, or sham operation
